subdisciplines.name: Network Security
subdisciplines.description: The practice of securing computer networks from unauthorized access or damage.

subdisciplines.name: Cryptography
subdisciplines.description: The practice of secure communication in the presence of third parties. It relies on mathematically idealized schemes to provide confidentiality, integrity, and authenticity guarantees.

subdisciplines.name: Application Security
subdisciplines.description: The use of software, hardware, and procedural methods to protect applications from external threats.
